sub_topic: Determining the genus of a graph.
message_1: Find the genus of the complete graph K_{10}.
message_2:
The genus of a graph is the minimum number of handles required on a surface to embed the graph without any edge crossings. For a complete graph K_n, the genus g can be found using the formula:

g = (n - 3)(n - 4)/12

In the case of K_{10}, we have n = 10. Plugging this into the formula, we get:

g = (10 - 3)(10 - 4)/12 = (7)(6)/12 = 42/12 = 3.5

However, the genus must be an integer, so we round up to the nearest integer:

g = 4

So, the genus of the complete graph K_{10} is 4.
